snippet: Data released Wednesday showed France slipping into recession and Germany eking out weak growth, but analysts said any new plans to stimulate growth remained unlikely.
abstract: Data indicates that Europe slipped deeper into widespread recession in first quarter of 2013, with euro zone output declining for a record six consecutive quarters; France slid into recession and Germany eked out weak growth, but analysts say any new plans to stimulate growth remains unlikely, as European Union seems to be in policy paralysis.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Data released Wednesday showed France slipping into recession and Germany eking out weak growth, but analysts said any new plans to stimulate growth remained unlikely.

headline.main: Euro Zone Politics Hinder Response as Slump Persists
headline.print_headline: Politics Hinder Progress On Europe’s Economy
